verses.text: In the third month after the sons of Israel had gone out of the land of Egypt, on that very day, they came into the wilderness of Sinai.
verses.comment: The phrase 'on that very day' follows the literal Hebrew 'in the same day.'

verses.text: After they set out from Rephidim and came into the wilderness of Sinai, they camped in the wilderness. Israel camped there before the mountain.
verses.comment: Maintains the structure and literal word order.

verses.text: Moses went up to God, and the LORD called to him from the mountain, saying, 'This is what you shall say to the house of Jacob and tell the sons of Israel:
verses.comment: The term 'sons of Israel' (Hebrew: benê yiśrā’ēl) is preserved rather than 'children' for accuracy.

verses.text: 'You have seen what I did to Egypt, and how I bore you on eagles' wings and brought you to Myself.'
verses.comment: The phrase 'how I bore you on eagles’ wings' retains the metaphor and construction of the Hebrew.

verses.text: 'Now therefore, if you will indeed obey My voice and keep My covenant, then you shall be My treasured possession out of all the peoples, for all the earth is Mine.'
verses.comment: 'Treasured possession' is translated from the Hebrew segullah. Meaning preserved.

verses.text: 'And you shall be to Me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.' These are the words you shall speak to the sons of Israel.
verses.comment: The phrase 'kingdom of priests and a holy nation' is translated as literally as possible.

verses.text: So Moses came and called the elders of the people, and set before them all these words that the LORD had commanded him.
verses.comment: 'Set before them' follows the literal language.

verses.text: And all the people answered together and said, 'All that the LORD has spoken we will do.' And Moses brought back the words of the people to the LORD.
verses.comment: Literal rendering, with the repetition of 'words.'

verses.text: And the LORD said to Moses, 'Behold, I am coming to you in a thick cloud, so that the people may hear when I speak with you and believe you forever.' Then Moses told the words of the people to the LORD.
verses.comment: 'Thick cloud' is a literal translation of Hebrew 'ʿānān ʿāvēh.'

verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, 'Go to the people and consecrate them today and tomorrow, and let them wash their clothes.'
verses.comment: 'Consecrate' uses the literal word for sanctify/set apart.

verses.text: And be ready for the third day. For on the third day the LORD will come down on Mount Sinai in the sight of all the people.
verses.comment: Closely follows the Hebrew syntax.

verses.text: You shall set limits for the people all around, saying, 'Beware of going up the mountain or touching its edge. Whoever touches the mountain shall surely be put to death.'
verses.comment: The phrase 'set limits' matches the biblical expression for a boundary.

verses.text: No hand shall touch him, but he shall surely be stoned or shot through; whether beast or man, he shall not live. When the trumpet sounds a long blast, they shall come up to the mountain.
verses.comment: 'Shot through' means pierced with arrows, following the original meaning.

verses.text: So Moses went down from the mountain to the people and consecrated the people, and they washed their clothes.
verses.comment: Literal rendering of 'consecrated.'

verses.text: And he said to the people, 'Be ready for the third day; do not go near a woman.'
verses.comment: The instruction 'do not go near a woman' is a literal translation of the Hebrew.

verses.text: On the morning of the third day there were thunders and lightnings and a thick cloud on the mountain, and a very loud sound of a trumpet, so that all the people in the camp trembled.
verses.comment: 'Sound of a trumpet' is literal for 'voice of the shofar.'

verses.text: Then Moses brought the people out of the camp to meet God, and they stood at the foot of the mountain.
verses.comment: The phrase 'at the foot of the mountain' is a literal rendering.

verses.text: Now Mount Sinai was wrapped in smoke because the LORD descended on it in fire. Its smoke went up like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain trembled greatly.
verses.comment: The terms 'wrapped in smoke' and 'trembled greatly' maintain the sense of the Hebrew.

verses.text: As the sound of the trumpet grew louder and louder, Moses spoke, and God answered him with a voice.
verses.comment: Literal repetition and rhythm preserved.

verses.text: The LORD came down on Mount Sinai, to the top of the mountain. And the LORD called Moses to the top of the mountain, and Moses went up.
verses.comment: Repetition reflects Hebrew style.

verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, 'Go down and warn the people, lest they break through to the LORD to look, and many of them perish.'
verses.comment: The phrase 'break through to the LORD' is translated literally.

verses.text: Also let the priests who come near to the LORD consecrate themselves, lest the LORD break out against them.
verses.comment: 'Break out against them' is a literal translation.

verses.text: Moses said to the LORD, 'The people cannot come up to Mount Sinai, for You Yourself warned us, saying, “Set limits around the mountain to consecrate it.”'
verses.comment: Direct quote from earlier verse is preserved.

verses.text: The LORD said to him, 'Go down and come up, you and Aaron with you; but do not let the priests and the people break through to come up to the LORD, lest He break out against them.'
verses.comment: Aaron is mentioned for the first time here. Literal rendering.

verses.text: So Moses went down to the people and spoke to them.
verses.comment: Simple, direct translation as in the Hebrew.
